Subject: Best practices to keep scenarios outside of the unit test
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=486647753
X-Yahoo-Newman-Property: groups-system
X-eGroups-Approved-By: spchappell <simonpeterchappell@...> via web; 22 Apr 2012 18:15:23 -0000

Hello all,

I'm looking for a good way to keep scenarios stored outside of the
unit tests.  Basically I'm thinking of some way to do black box
testing based on some files, hopefully something simple enough that a
non programmer can take look at and modify.

Some thing that takes a few inputs for a function and lists the
expected output.

Something like but obviously for much more complicated tests:

input1=1
input2=2
output=3

input1=2
input2=2
output=4


Any ideas on how to do this?

Thanks,

Andres
subject: Best practices to keep scenarios outside of the unit test
